sources.title: Back Page (1933) crime exposé film, directed by Anton Lorenze | starring Peggy Shannon
sources.description:
A former New York reporter (Peggy Shannon) is hired as editor of a failing, small town newspaper in California.

Colorized version https://youtu.be/VTWaZMumrfM

Director: Anton Lorenze
Writers: Harry Chandlee, Douglas W. Churchill, F. McGrew Willis
Stars: Peggy Shannon, Russell Hopton, Claude Gillingwater

Genres: Crime, Drama, Poverty Row
Release date: November 7, 1933
Filming location: Hollywood.


@CultCinemaClassics

sources.title: 1933 - Back Page - Film Noir - Press vs. Power: When Headlines Pack a Punch!
sources.description:
When crusading reporter Jerry Hampton’s explosive story gets spiked by corrupt publisher Martin Blake, she launches an ink-stained rebellion in Apex, California—but her headlines collide with Blake’s backroom oil fraud and Brice Regal’s flirtatious distractions. Armed with a typewriter and grit, Jerry exposes the tycoon’s schemes, outmaneuvers stone-faced businessman Sam Webster, and proves small-town presses roar back to life when truth’s on the frontlines.

Main Cast:
Peggy Shannon - Jerry Hampton
Russell Hopton - Brice Regal
Claude Gillingwater - Sam Webster
Edwin Maxwell - Martin Regal
Sterling Holloway - Bill Giddings
Rockliffe Fellowes - John Levings
Richard Tucker - John H. Smith
Bryant Washburn - Barman

Directed by Anton Lorenze

B&W version: https://youtu.be/NJLEOIl3RXE

metadata.Plot: Peggy Shannon plays a young female reporter who is fired from a big city newspaper, then decides to take over a troubled small town newspaper. She encounters difficulties with small town politics, getting advertisers to help keep the paper afloat, and issues with 1930's feminism in the resistance she receives from the town's residents to her attempts to run the newspaper. An insightful story of a woman's determination to succeed in an era long before the women's rights movement.
metadata.Writer: Harry Chandlee, Douglas W. Churchill, F. McGrew Willis
metadata.Actors: Peggy Shannon, Russell Hopton, Claude Gillingwater
